meanings.definition: The domain or realm of dogs.
meanings.sent1: In the park, the dogedom was filled with playful pups chasing after balls.
meanings.sent2: The dogedom at the animal shelter was a safe haven for abandoned pets.
meanings.sent3: The dogedom of the backyard was ruled by a fluffy golden retriever.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the dogedom seemed to glow with the happiness of wagging tails.
meanings.sent5: Children giggled as they entered the dogedom, surrounded by furry friends.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being dominated by dogs.
meanings.sent1: After adopting three rescue dogs, our home was in complete dogedom.
meanings.sent2: Walking through the neighborhood, I could sense the dogedom of the area with so many pet owners around.
meanings.sent3: Despite his tough appearance, he couldn't resist the dogedom of his tiny poodle.
meanings.sent4: The dogedom of the office was evident with the boss's loyal canine companion always by his side.
meanings.sent5: She embraced the dogedom of her life, finding joy in every bark and tail wag.
